title: Print, "Floral and Acanthus Leaf Design", 1740
inscribed: Inscribed on plate, upper left: A; upper right: 4; lower left: Peirotte in; lower right: huquier Sculp et ex a Paris rue des Mathurins C.P.R.; written on plate in graphite, verso: les 6 feuilles/(unreadable, see object); written on mount in graphite, upper right: n° 4
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Large ornament design consisting of swirling acanthus leaves, known as raffle leaves, forming C and S scrolls. Amongst the leaves are clusters of flowers with their natural foliage.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Floral and Acanthus Leaf Design", 1740.
1740. Etcher on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-213-4.
